reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed at Llangoed hall in November 2011, and had a fantastic time over two nights.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we arrived we were greeted on the drive, where our bags were carried to our rooms, check in was quick, and we were then shown around the building and then to our room. Our room was large and well equipped, and the bed was fantastic, made me doubt the suitability of my tiny double bed.
reviews.title: beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a short spell of exploring we went to have our evening meal – food was excellent, a modern style menu, but not so modern you were still hungry after, as is the case in some restaurants. The following day breakfast was also excellent with the normal choice of cooked or continental.
reviews.title: llangoed hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding area is typically Welsh – beautiful, remote and peaceful, it doesn’t get much better than Welsh countryside in my opinion. The hotel offers many attractions whilst visiting and more a little further afield.
reviews.title: First class experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At Llangoed hall the atmosphere was relaxed; it felt like a home from home, it was very quite and relaxing.
reviews.title: Gracious country hall with fantastic art collection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Used the Travelzoo deal and stayed 2 nights. The place is stunning - the staff are very welcoming and the food is excellent. Agreed some of the carpets are a little grubby but this is outweighed by the furniture and paintings. Huge fireplace in the Lounge, grand piano in the Morning Room and snooker table in the Games Room - all to enjoy when the weather outside is less than welcoming! A great shame about their current financial situation and we hope the staff and the Hall are able to weather the storm.
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited the first week in December with two other couples. Llangoed is a beautiful country mansion in the heart of the Welsh countryside. A fabulous venue for meeting up with friends. We stayed in Room 7 which was huge, beautifully decorated with original Laura Ashley wallpaper and furnishings and had splendid views of the Brecon Beacons. There was a decanter of sherry and a plate of fruit on arrival, a large bathroom and shower and a massive comfortable double bed. We booked in for dinner and stayed until 1.30am chatting with friends. A special mention to Andrew who took our orders, ensuring our drinks were replenished without being obtrusive, he was a great asset to the establishment. In fact all the staff were fantastic. The young lad who took our cases and helped us find our other friends in the hotel was also a great ambassador.
reviews.title: Provate, discreet and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a comfortable discreet break away from it all in quality surroundings, this is the place to visit. We loved it so much, we are booking up same time next year. Thank you everybody who made our visit so enjoyable.
reviews.title: A Grand Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I took out the TravelZoo offer and were very impressed with this Hotel. Yes it is not perfect, small carpet stains (covered discretely with a well placed paper bin!), no really usable shower etc. However the bedroom and bathroom were massive with a good standard of period furniture with a four poster bed. The food was excellent and the staff were excellent too. The building was superb with it's staircase, panneling and paintings and it gave out an aura of grandeur. The log fires and the cosy lounges made this a winter stopover of the best order. What a shame for the staff that this Hotel is in Administration. I wish them all the best for the future.
reviews.title: Doesn't get much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent country house hotel, friendly helpful staff (who declined tips) very comfortable and little extras included eg decanter of sherry, fresh fruit, evening turn down and room service morning tea.
reviews.title: Beautiful Country House style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bought the Travelzoo Dinner Bed & B'fast voucher (really good value) and stayed one night a couple of weeks before Xmas. Fantastic room with lovely views over fields towards River Wye. Dinner and breakfast were both excellent, made even more pleasant by the attentive but inobtrusive staff. As mentioned by others, bathroom could do with refurbishment but overall a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bought a weekend package from Travelzoo, very affordable for what was on offer. Stayed a Sunday and Monday nights with breakfast and evening meals included.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This establishment is a relaxation dream....time seems to pass very slowly in this hotel, nothing is rushed.
reviews.title: Nostalgic Elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast and food in general was superb (1st class)
reviews.title: An aging princess of a palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms are well furnished and the views and surrounding areas are great
reviews.title: An AMAZING Christmas!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We got a great deal through Travelzoo and I have to say it really was an amazing deal. Irrespective of this, the hotel is really very nice. The rooms are all enormous, we were had 5 rooms between us and all were as good as each other. Many have four poster beds and the decor is very much country house. my only gripe about the rooms are that the bathrooms need a little updating. None of them had showers (only a shower in the bath but no screen) and there was a general tired feel to all of the ones I saw. We had dinner and it was good but I agree with another reviewer in that I would not really want to pay £45 a head for it.
reviews.title: Great Place to Escape to for a weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, it is a lovely country hotel in beautiful surroundings and we would definitely go back, in fact we have already booked!!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL PITY ABOUT THE DINNER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful situation,spacious well furnished and clean rooms.Very friendly.Lovely open fires.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a wonderful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast.It was unfortunate that I had to send back the main course of tough lamb,no apology or response.Pot of tea is £3 each.The evening meal is normally £45 each for three courses and to be honest is not worth that.We went on a Travelzoo voucher and thus had a really good deal.
reviews.title: Old fashioned charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great place for a short break summer or winter,with the big log fires,excellent food and attentive
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back
Lovely in winter
reviews.text: The size of the lounges and the log fires, plus the fascinating works of art all over the place, make this one of our favourite places for a quiet and relaxed winter weekend, walking in the Black Mountains and stopping at the Hay on Wye bookshops.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004
reviews.text: The bedrooms have been somewhat refurbished, the lighting everywhere is far too dim, and the menu the same each night - but somehow the place itself is the draw. Yet again the manager has changed, and even though we were there for 3 days he didn't actually introduce himself, alhough it wasn't at all busy - but maybe he was?
reviews.title: Different and well worth it
Fabulous meal and a classic, small but luxurious manor
reviews.text: Dramatic drive to the hotel, particularly in autumn / fall when the ivy covered walls turn red and then no reception desk, just a 'butler' to provide all the help you need.
